We charge $25 for shipping to FFL.

In 1961, Grady & Ann Phillips opened “The Sport and Hobby Shop” in an 840 sf vacancy in the Pruitt Shopping Center in Anderson, SC. This store stocked model cars, fishing supplies, athletic goods and a total of two guns. Growth came quickly and in 1963, the store was moved 3 doors down in the shopping center to a 1,400 sf location. Here Grady and Ann added more firearms, toys, games and even Barbie Dolls!

As the business continued to grow, it was moved in 1965 to a 2,400 sf building in the then-new Belvedere Plaza Shopping Center. Horseback riding equipment, western wear and more toys and hobbies were added to the inventory. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Sport Shop” – a name by which some people still refer to us today.

In 1969, Grady and Ann decided to focus on the core business – hunting and fishing. The store was moved one door down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 3,600 sf location. The variety of hunting and fishing equipment was expanded and a mail-order division was started. Grady began producing direct-mail flyers which are still our most effective form of advertising today.

Explosive growth came in the early 70's and the store was moved 3 doors down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 7,000 sf building – almost double the size of the previous location. 10 years later, Grady and Ann felt that a free-standing building would best serve our customers. Property was secured in our current location and a 9,800 sf building was constructed. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Great Outdoors” at this time.

Over the last 22 years, the original structure has been expanded and remodeled to its current 19,000+ sf size.

Our current line-up of products includes: Hunting, Fishing, Camping, Kayaks & Canoes, Casual & Work Clothing, Casual & Work Footwear and much more!! We carry virtually all of the major brands as well as many hard-to-find specialty items.

Grady’s Great Outdoors continues to be owned and operated by the Phillips Family. We cannot express how much we appreciate the support of our customers over the last 50 years. We look forward to serving you for the next 50 years!

title: For Sale/Trade:  Springfield Armory Lightweight Champion Operator 1911
postcontent:
I have a Springfield Armory Lightweight Champion Operator 1911 for sale and possible trade for certain items only.  Low-ball offers will just be deleted. This is in mint condition. There is nothing wrong with it. I went to the local gun shop a week ago and was told these are very hard to get right now and have been for some time. The last picture is the grouping with this 1911. The target was 30 yards away. The thrown shots was me shooting with my left hand. 

A little bit about this 1911:
The Springfield Armory Lightweight Champion Operator 1911 is an all-business pistol for conceal carry or combat.

The pistols is about 30 oz unloaded, comes with very bright Trijicon Night Sights. The frame is constructed with an integral universal accessory rail for lasers, tactical lights or other accessories. The pistol has a 4" match grade bull barrel with a fully supported ramp. The trigger is match grade as well, with a trigger pull weight of 4.5 lbs with a 7.5" overall length. An ambidextrous safety allows right and left handed shooters to operated the lever easily. This 1911 pistol is equipped with a trigger locking device. A key inserted into a hole in the rear grip strap positively locks the trigger, making it impossible for a child to accidentally discharge the gun. 

Extras:
(6) 7rnds Mags
(1) 10rnds Mag
Leather 1911 Mag pouch
(2) IWB Leather Holsters – both are customer made holsters. 
(1) OWB Leather Holster. 

Price: $1,100

ONLY TRADES:
M&P 45ACP plus cash.
LMT lower plus cash
LMT complete AR15
Springfield MC Operator

In 1961, Grady & Ann Phillips opened “The Sport and Hobby Shop” in an 840 sf vacancy in the Pruitt Shopping Center in Anderson, SC. This store stocked model cars, fishing supplies, athletic goods and a total of two guns. Growth came quickly and in 1963, the store was moved 3 doors down in the shopping center to a 1,400 sf location. Here Grady and Ann added more firearms, toys, games and even Barbie Dolls!

As the business continued to grow, it was moved in 1965 to a 2,400 sf building in the then-new Belvedere Plaza Shopping Center. Horseback riding equipment, western wear and more toys and hobbies were added to the inventory. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Sport Shop” – a name by which some people still refer to us today.

In 1969, Grady and Ann decided to focus on the core business – hunting and fishing. The store was moved one door down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 3,600 sf location. The variety of hunting and fishing equipment was expanded and a mail-order division was started. Grady began producing direct-mail flyers which are still our most effective form of advertising today.

Explosive growth came in the early 70's and the store was moved 3 doors down in the Belvedere Plaza to a 7,000 sf building – almost double the size of the previous location. 10 years later, Grady and Ann felt that a free-standing building would best serve our customers. Property was secured in our current location and a 9,800 sf building was constructed. The name was also changed to “Grady’s Great Outdoors” at this time.

Over the last 22 years, the original structure has been expanded and remodeled to its current 19,000+ sf size.

Our current line-up of products includes: Hunting, Fishing, Camping, Kayaks & Canoes, Casual & Work Clothing, Casual & Work Footwear and much more!! We carry virtually all of the major brands as well as many hard-to-find specialty items.

Grady’s Great Outdoors continues to be owned and operated by the Phillips Family. We cannot express how much we appreciate the support of our customers over the last 50 years. We look forward to serving you for the next 50 years!

postcontent: It is a 2006 Arctic Cat F5 Sno Pro that is in really good condition. It has been garage stored and well maintained with just under 2900 miles on it. title: For Sale:  Polish Beryl AK Folding Stock Excellent Condition
postcontent: I bought 2 of these and they don't fit one of my AK's ( American Tactical Imports AT-47) so I'm selling the other one. As long as you have a normal stamped receiver, this stock will fit (Not an AT-47 and not one of those slanted MAK-90 receivers). You need a NORMAL stamped AKM receiver such as a WASR. By far this is the best folding stock design there is for an AK. It's lightning fast to open and it's rock solid steel with a nice rubber butt pad. I'm selling it for $100 because I barely used it AND I'm including the screws you need to install it, which I had to order from the U.K. for about an additional $15 Then I had to take the time to shorten one up. RTG doesn't sell the screws and good luck finding what metric thread pitch you need. I don't remember how I found them but I did. The block that slides into the receiver and screws into the trunnion doesn't stick out like some of the folding stocks I've seen for sale from K-VAR either. This stock is a really quick way to add some badassery to your stamped receiver rifle and it's ROCK SOLID. No wobble or play in this thing at all.

title: For Sale:  REDUCED .30-40 Krag US carbine, Springfield model 1896
postcontent:
offered for sale is this Spanish-American War-era Krag carbine, made for the US Army by Springfield Armory. If you're not already familiar with these weapons, the Wiki page has some good info – http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Springfield_Model_1892-99

This weapon probably started out as a rifle, and was modified to suit a civilian use, but it is interesting just as an example of this type of weapon and for some of its features. The side-loading magazine is of particular interest, (believed unique to this model) designed to allow reloading by a soldier in the prone position. The elevation rear sight is also an interesting feature, though I would think that the maximum range of 2000 yards is at least a little optimistic! The muzzle configuration is apparently an attempt to form a sort of muzzle brake or flash suppressor -- I have no idea whether it is effective.

The first picture gives an overall view of the weapon -- about 43½" long, with a barrel of about 23". It weighs a hair under 8 pounds empty. There is some pitting evident on the exposed metal; I have not disassembled it to inspect the metal inside the stock. There is no apparent rust. Although the weapon clearly has been shot a good bit (part of the reason I think it's likely seen use in battle), there is good rifling in the bore, and I think it will shoot well. I personally have never loaded or fired this weapon, and as for any 100+-year-old weapon, if you intend to fire it, I would encourage a thorough inspection by a qualified gunsmith, and appropriate caution in loading and operation. The stock has likely been refinished with varnish. It is in overall good condition, but has several scratches and would be improved with a new coat of varnish.

The only marks I can find on the metal (again, without disassembling the weapon) are on the receiver which (as shown in the 2d picture) is marked:

U.S.
MODEL 1896. SPRINGFIELD ARMORY. 558XX

On the left side of the stock below the bolt the underlined letters WI are marked on the stock, under the varnish -- likely the initials of a previous owner or the soldier who carried it.

The weapon is chambered for the .30-40 Krag cartridge. Included in the sale are five rounds of loaded ammunition which I believe to be of modern manufacture, as well as a set of Lee loading dies and 96 new shell casings. The cartridge takes the same .308" diameter bullets used in many other modern loads, and reloading data is widely available.

I can provide many more pictures if desired, and I'll be happy to answer any questions, or even put it in your hand for a look-see if you're seriously interested in owning it.

postcontent:
You bought an AR, now what? This course is a must take!

Mid-Ohio Personal Defense Solutions is very excite to announce Mid-Ohio's only Carbine Course. This course is taught by experienced instructors and trainers as well as custom carbine-smiths. 


The Defensive Carbine Course is designed to provide each student with the core skills needed to properly and effectively utilize an AR based carbine both safely and effective manner in both defensive and hunting applications. 


This intense one-day (8-hour) course will include:

Safety

History of the AR Platform

Nomenclature

Carbine functions and Basic Build

Operation and Manipulation

Ammunition Selection

Ballistics

Optics and Optics zeroing

Basics of MOA and MilDot usage

Trigger control

Shooting positions 


Precision shooting out to 50 yards

Close Quarter Battle Drills 

Balancing Speed vs. Accuracy 

Personal / Home Defense Considerations

Malfunctions and Resolutions


This course includes 4 hours of practical instruction, followed by 4 hours of practical application and shooting at our shooting range.

This course is primarily designed for the AR platform. However, students are welcomed to bring any other serviceable carbines such as, AK's Mini-14s, SK/SKS, etc. Please understand that portions of the course may not apply to these specific weapon systems.

•Eye protection

•Hearing protection


This course will be held in Butler, Ohio (near Mansfield, about 1 hour north of Columbus), with the classroom portion being taught at the Worthington Township Fire Department and the shooting taking place at our private range about 5 minutes from the fire station. title: For Sale:  Give me your best offer! - 1981 HK91 .308 7.62x51 Heckler & Koch G3 A2 Good
postcontent: For sale is a 1981 Heckler & Koch 91, the civilian version of the military G3. This is a rare gun. Chambered in .308 Winchester/7.62mm caliber. I’m told H&K only imported about 48,000 of these from ’74 to ’89. This is NOT an aftermarket 91 or a CETME. Most of the parts are not original to the receiver, but most are still H&K made parts I believe (with a few exceptions). The gun shoots beautifully. It will feed anything you want to put through it. As you can tell, this gun is certainly not in “like new” condition. Instead, it has obviously been used in the past. The pictures should tell you fairly well what kind of shape this gun is in. This gun comes with both the wood furniture and the plastic furniture, for whatever mood you are in. As you can tell, it has a “wide” OD Green hand guard with bipod. Also, it comes with four (4) magazines and a Tapco scope mount. Get this rifle while you still can! Know your local laws before you commit. I can E-mail you more pictures if you are interested. $1800 or best offer. Please don't low-ball me, since I really like this gun.

Factory New in Box

* Description: 	GLK 23 40SW PST 13RD FS

Stocking

All items are in stock at the time of listing. Should any item become out of stock the item will be re-ordered to fulfill the auction listing. Out-of-stock orders generally ship within 10-12 days.

Payment

The following payment options are available. Cash, Check, and Money Order payments are due within 10 days of auction close.

* Credit Card. Visa or Mastercard (no added fees) are accepted. Please see our website (www.spartan-arms.com) or call 901-491-9505 for payment information.
* We accept money orders, personal checks, or certified checks. Contact us for address information.
* We accept check by phone. Please call 901-491-9505 to complete.

Shipping

Shipping is UPS or USPS in the Continental U.S. We do not ship international. Orders shipped upon receipt of payment and FFL information. A tracking number or confirmation number can be provided by e-mail upon shipment, if requested.

* $35 for Long Guns.
* $25 for Handguns.
* Multiple items will ship together with only one shipping charge.
* Please add $15 additional for shipments to Alaska and Hawaii.

Product Guarantee

Warranties are handled by the manufacturer. Warranty claims need to be directed to the manufacturer, as warranties are between the owner (that's you) and the warrantor. However if you need service or warranty work on a new piece of equipment and need our help in accessing them, we will be glad to answer any questions or help you get in contact with the right party.

All used items are "as is" and no warranties are given or implied. No refunds on firearms if transferred. Inspect the weapon at the dealer! Shipping and Handling is not refundable. Most product photos are of the actual item. Occasionally we will use stock photos on our listing. Some serial numbers in the photos will not match the actual item.

Firearms are warrantied by the MANUFACTURER.

* All used items are "as is" and no warranties are given or implied by Spartan Arms.
* Once a firearm has been transferred, it is now used.
* All guns from Davidson's come with Davidson's lifetime warranty.

Product Returns

All sales are final. We do not accept Returns or exchanges. Please be sure that you are legally able to purchase the firearm in your area. Any purchases that cannot be accepted or are refused by the FFL will incur a minimum $25 restocking fee for handguns and a minimum $35 restocking fee for Long guns.
